pp2016.team19.shared

Class Character

  • java.lang.Object
    • pp2016.team19.shared.Character
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    Monster, Player

    public abstract class Character
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable

    Abstract Character Class providing position, direction, game, health, ID and damage.

    It contains the constructor, the A-Star-Search algorithm, move methods, methods to calculate the next steps and whether steps are valid or walkable, as well as getter and setter methods.
    Author:
    Strohbuecker, Max, 5960738
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      • xPos

        public int xPos
        Attributes of class Character. xPos: x-coordinate of the characters position // yPos: y-coordinate of the characters position // dir: direction, where the character should go next // game: game which the character belongs to / exists in // health: health of the player // ID: ID of the character to uniquely identify it // damage: damage the character deals // maxHealth: the maximum health the character should have

    • Method Detail

      • AStarSearch

        public java.util.LinkedList<Node> AStarSearch(int xStart,
                                              int yStart,
                                              int xGoal,
                                              int yGoal)
        A-Star-Algorithm to search the shortest path from start to goal. Build on a pseudocode from: http://web.mit.edu/eranki/www/tutorials/search/
        Parameters:
        xStart - x-coordinate of the starting point
        yStart - y-coordinate of the starting point
        xGoal - x-coordinate of the goal
        yGoal - x-coordinate of the goal
        Returns:
        returns the calculated path

      • changeDir

        public boolean changeDir(java.util.LinkedList<Node> path)
        Removes the next step/node of the AStarPath and changes the running direction of the monster.
        Parameters:
        path - the path, of which the next step/node should be calculated
        Returns:
        returns false if a monster blocks the way, otherwise returns true

      • isWalkable

        public boolean isWalkable(int x,
                          int y)
        Calculates, whether the target position is walkable.
        Parameters:
        x - x-coordinate of the target position
        y - y-coordinate of the target position
        Returns:
        returns true if field is free, returns false if field is a wall
